model module

class model.Model(urdf_file_path, q=None, v=None, a=None)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for multijoint models.

Args:

  • urdf_file_path (str): Manipulator description file path.

  • model (Pinocchio.Model): Pinocchio multibody model of the system.

  • params (dict): Model static parameters.

  • data (Pinocchio.Data): Pinocchio multibody data model.

  • q (np.ndarray): Joints position vector.

  • v (np.ndarray): Joints velocity vector.

  • a (np.ndarray): Joints acceleration vector.

compute_corlolis_matrix(qp=None, q=None)[source]

Compute the Coriolis matrix using automatic differentiation with JAX.

Args:

  • qp: Joints Velocity vector.

  • q : Joints Position vector.

Returns:

  • C : JAX numpy array (jnp.ndarray)

compute_generalized_torques(q=None, qp=None, qpp=None, fext=None)
compute_generalized_torques(q, qp, qpp, fext=None)

Helper for @overload to raise when called.

compute_gravity_torques(q=None)[source]

Computes the joints gravity torques given a configuration vector.

Args:

  • q : joints position vector (nq * 1)

Returns:

  • tau_g : numpy.ndarray.

compute_mass_matrix(q=None, scaling=0.0001)[source]

Compute the mass matrix of the system. the matrix is computed by getting the inverse of it using pinncyoi

Args:

  • q : Joints position vector.

  • scaling : float used in scaling the mass matrix to prevent singulaty

compute_stiffness_torques(coeffs, q=None)[source]

Compute the torques resulting from joints torsional stiffness

Args:

q (numpy.ndarray): Configuration vector.

Returns:

numpy.ndarray: Joints stiffness torques.
